establishement_address: 536 Avenue Duluth E, Montréal, QC H2L 1A9, Canada
establishement_address2: 11382, rang de la Fresnière, St Benoit de Mirabel, QC J7N 2R9, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Martin Picard’s cholesterol-fueled emporium continues to churn out its famous foie gras poutine and duck-in-a-can. From May to October, you can also find Picard’s delicacies in a food truck on the streets of Montréal.
influencer2_quote_text: You need to show up hungry to the point of predatory. The city's dining scene thrives on fortifying food, but Au Pied de Cochon is the most unremitting-fantastically so.

establishement_address: 1227 Rue de la Montagne, Montréal, QC H3G 1Z2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Chef Ferrer hails from Languedoc, and his cooking is assertively French—but rooted in the Quebec terroir, and infused with a lot of New World levity. A signature lobster bisque is frothed and so becomes a lobster “cappuccino.”
influencer2_quote_text: Jérome Ferrer est un excellent ambassadeur de la gastronomie de la « lointaine province ». Son tartare de bison crispy, ses pétoncles géants caramélisés au jus de citronnade et ses cannellonis de crabe de Gaspésie en bulbe de céleri sont là pour en témoigner.

establishement_address: 351 Rue Saint Paul O, Montréal, QC H2Y 2A7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Often frequented by workers, Olive & Gourmando is always full and for a reason: they make super tasty sandwiches and warm beverages. You’ll love the subdued light and special decoration that are perfect for a romantic link up or to meet up with friends.
influencer2_quote_text: Olive & Gourmando est un pionnier du domaine; ouvert en 1997, à l’époque où la boulangerie n’était pas du tout glorifiée comme aujourd’hui. L’endroit est maintenant un classique ; pour les brunchs, lunchs ou pour emporter.

establishement_address: 5171 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R9, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: I could write this whole review about Hotel Herman’s cocktails, which are complex and so glamorously retro. Then there’s the bread, made on­site, enhanced with rye, thickly crusted, and dangerously scarúable.
influencer2_quote_text: Hotel Herman is a not a hotel at all, but rather a restaurant loved by the local tattooed and long-bearded crowd. It’s where the nocturnal Mile End crowd can hang out and listen to vinyl records—because, of course, there is a turntable near the entrance.

establishement_address: 4764 Avenue Papineau, Montréal, QC H2L 2R5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: What that roving kitchen did, this new sit-down spot does even more so. I’ll admit that I walked in wanting to love it, but I didn’t leave disappointed. There’s a touch of grand-mère about the place that gets you in a warm embrace.
influencer2_quote_text: How can you resist such an exaltation? Don't, it would be a shame, because everything is as described. Every plate and dish is delicious, balanced, and enthuastically enjoyable. You need a special kind of talent to be able to generate enthusiasm for brussel sprouts.

establishement_address: 95 Rue Jean-Talon O, Montréal, QC H2R 2W8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The beers here are either named after jersey numbers belonging to the people who work there or someone who’s had a big influence on the place. If you’re looking for something light and easy-drinking, the 21 is a blonde ale dedicated to Veilleux’s dad and his hockey jersey.
influencer2_quote_text: The menu is a mix of modernized tavern snacks and comfort food. From the first bite to the last, it’s obvious that the person in the kitchen can really cook.

establishement_address: 1432 Rue Mackay, Montréal, QC H3G 2H7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The granddaddy of third-wave coffee in Montreal and founder of Café Myriade, Anthony Benda has completely reinvented craft coffee in the city. There are now three locations to choose from, but we prefer the original cramped little coffee front on Rue Mackay.
influencer2_quote_text: The OG Myriade is perfectly situated for you to grab a brew from 49th Parallel Roasters and guest roasters and a yummy snack before you hit the books.

establishement_address: 4720 Rue Marquette, Montréal, QC H2J 3Y6, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Local celebrity chef Derek Dammann teamed up with the famed British chef Jamie Oliver to open this pub-style restaurant that perfectly blends Canadian and British traditions. The interior is dark and cozy, and a long counter takes up one side of the space—it's fun to sit here because you get a prime view of the tattooed chefs in action.
influencer2_quote_text: Drawing on the best ingredients from across the country, and putting them through an internationally inspired range of techniques, the kitchen is able to turn out some of the most exciting, dynamic food anywhere. Hearty Beach Angel oysters are paired with marmite and mushrooms for a surprise blast of oceanic umami, creamy foie gras mousse is slathered on toast and served with gherkins.

establishement_address: 994 Rue Rachel E, Montréal, QC H2J 2J3
influencer1_quote_text: La Banquise has been satiating poutine cravings for 48 years and counting. Try their “La Reggae”, which features ground beef, guacamole, diced tomatoes and hot peppers. Open 24 hours a day, La Banquise is a popular spot for the after-hours crowd and is a great place to spot celebrities getting in on some famous Montréal poutine.
influencer2_quote_text: Real poutine. The kind where the cheese squeaks with every bite, the fries are pork larded to perfection and the sauce? Not too little, not too much, it's a salty brew with just the right hue of brown.

establishement_address: 2491 Notre Dame Street West
influencer1_quote_text: Chefs Martin Picard, David McMillan and Frederic Morin are masters of foodfuckery. They are loved, respected and feared by chefs from all over the world who’ve visited them at their restaurants in Montreal (Picard’s Au Pied de Cochon and McMillan and Morin’s Joe Beef and Liverpool House).
influencer2_quote_text: Since its opening in 2005, Joe Beef is one of the cornerstone restaurants that has helped Montreal garner its title as a premium destination for culinary travelers for its unapologetic, gluttonous cooking and unforgettable atmosphere.

establishement_address: 29 Avenue Laurier Ouest, Montréal, QC H2T 2N2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Dieu Du Ciel! have a back catalogue of beers that could make you weep with joy. With the fundamental principle that everything they brew should be beer for beer's sake, Dieu Du Ciel! have a huge range of beautifully crafted beers in almost every style your heart might desire.
influencer2_quote_text: On a cold January evening, cross your fingers and hope that the Charbonnière malt ale so smoky it almost tastes like bacon made the cut. In hot July, their famous tart and slightly acidic Rosé d’Hibiscus wheat beer is the perfect addition to their sidewalk patio, if you manage to get a seat.

establishement_address: 9 Fairmount Ave E, Montreal, Québec H2T, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Voyez le Larry’s comme un café européen; un endroit ouvert toute la journée, sept jours sur sept, où vous pouvez venir prendre un café et grignoter, déjeuner, dîner ou souper. « On voulait juste être un endroit où l’on peut passer à n’importe quelle heure de la journée, n’importe quel jour de la semaine et prendre un verre ou manger. On ne voulait pas être contraint à une définition. »
influencer2_quote_text: Du petit-déjeuner au souper post-théâtre en passant par le lunch, on sert à manger toutes les heures. Pour s'assurer que le café soit délicieux, on a fait appel à l'expertise de gens ayant longuement travaillé au fameux café Myriade.

establishement_address: 2360 Rue Notre-Dame O, Montréal, QC H3J 1N4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Patrice Pâtissier located in Little Burgundy just below downtown is easily one of the best pâtisseries in Montreal. [...] If you decide to sit and order dessert, go for Le Vert, a decadent (and now famous) dessert involving green apples, pistachios, olive oil, cilantro and a yogurt and white chocolate cream.
influencer2_quote_text: This elegantly designed patisserie has a modern, Scandinavian-like design, which makes a fine backdrop to the heavenly creations prepared here.

establishement_address: 6631 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Do J.P. and Marie-Claude even have your new cell number? What to do? Go back to the racines of it all and do a Wednesday night at Vices et Versa, where traditional Quebec music and traditional Quebec beer are the order of the day.
influencer2_quote_text: It's a low-key, local joint with occasional musical acts and a lovely backyard beer garden.

establishement_address: 1832 Rue William, Montréal, QC H3J 1R5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: With dishes like a peanut butter and jelly sandwich assembled on brioche bread and layered with foie gras (a.k.a. the PBJFG), seared beef tartare mixed with potatoes, raw quail’s egg and grapefruit oil, and lasagna made with slices of marinated celery root that are blowtorched right before serving, this kitchen is taking all kinds of risks. And succeeding!
influencer2_quote_text: The chef, whose pedigree includes stints at Corton in New York and Geist in Copenhagen, is making some of the city’s most interesting food in the forms of tempura garlic scapes and blowtorched celery root lasagna layered with Parmesan cream.

establishement_address: 51 Rue Sherbrooke O, Montréal, QC H2X 1X2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: A different kind of café just landed in downtown Montreal. Café OSMO, located in the landmark Notman House tech campus owned by the non-profit OSMO Foundation, wants to serve as a pulse point for entrepreneurs, developers, and the general public.
influencer2_quote_text: The coffee is being sourced from Anchored Coffee, a “microroastery” from Dartmouth, Nova Scotia. Williams said it was important for Café OSMO to buy from a high-quality supplier in order to compete with the popular shops around the block.

establishement_address: 1351 Rachel St E, Montreal, Québec H2J 2K2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: This Comptoir à Cocktails gets the nod for astute takes on classic cocktails, tiki drinks and seminars on topics like bitters, grogs, and molecular mixology. Over seven years in the game now, impressively.
influencer2_quote_text: Lab is a dimly lighted speakeasy of brick and dark wood where the mad mixologist Fabien Maillard and fellow “labtenders” ceaselessly research new cures for your sobriety.

establishement_address: 374 Avenue Victoria, Westmount, QC H3Z 2N4
influencer1_quote_text: Lavanderia’s Kobe burger is made with certified Kobe beef from Japan and is arguably one of the city’s most decadent. Popular Montréal chef and Food Network judge on “Chopped Canada,” Chef Antonio Park made headlines earlier this year when it was announced that he would be granted the sole importation license of the coveted Japanese beef.
influencer2_quote_text: The chef’s second restaurant, Lavanderia, was inspired by his childhood in South America. “I actually opened the restaurant, not for the customers, but because I wanted to eat that food every day,” Park admits. “I eat there every night.”

establishement_address: 3418 B Av. du Parc
influencer1_quote_text: You’ll literally feel like you’re in a bar, but with a more relaxed ambiance. Tucked in Parc Avenue, this small café is home to one of the best lattes I’ve had in Montreal.
influencer2_quote_text: Lors de nombreuses entrevues avec des restaurateurs, le meilleur café de Montréal est souvent ressorti comme étant le Pikolo Espresso bar. Nous sommes d’accord que le café propose l’un des meilleurs en ville, mais son décor charmant le place aussi dans notre liste des plus beaux cafés en ville.

establishement_address: 4627 Rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2J 2L4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Le décor est très épuré : grandes tables, quelques bancs de bois, l’esthétique est simple et jolie — bravo d’ailleurs pour les prises cachées sous les tables. La lumière est aussi toujours très agréable, tout comme le personnel.
influencer2_quote_text: Le Couteau offers a broad variety of coffee and several brewing techniques, which they will happily describe to help you choose something to meet your expectations. The second best thing about Le Couteau is the wide variety of Viennoiseries, scones and sweets they offer.

establishement_address: 1106 Maisonneuve Blvd W, Montreal, Québec H3A 1M7
influencer1_quote_text: As much as I enjoy a fun setting, I feared this restaurant’s supper club concept, not the food, was the priority. [...] But guess what? My dinner was amazing. Plate presentations were gorgeous, ingredients were chosen with care, and the delicious factor was sky high.
influencer2_quote_text: Soubois is either the raucous, after-party den where Diplo threw down after Madonna's recent Bell Centre residency, or the wild-edible-focused restaurant where two talented chefs, Guillaume Daly and S’arto Chartier-Otis, hold court.

establishement_address: 281 Rue Bernard O, Montréal, QC H2V 1T5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: I didn't want to be a burger restaurant. I didn't put a burger on the menu until two or three months in. It was a momentous decision. Seaton's menu is chock-full of crowd-pleasers — matzo ball soup, crab cakes, wedge salad, mac and cheese, grilled hanger steak — but her burger accounts for a big chunk of the restaurant's business.
influencer2_quote_text: With a super solid selection of awesome, tasty, and original brunch options – such as their famous lumberjack sandwich – Nouveau Palais is definitely going to be one of your new favourite brunch spots in the city. Of course, they also score huge bonus points due to the fact that they serve up some seriously legit mimosas for under $7.

establishement_address: 5605 Avenue de Gaspé, Montréal, QC H2T 2M1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: There is a mix of Tokyo, Paris, and Montreal in Café Falco, a little gem hided in an otherwise generic warehouse building on a side street near the east end of Saint-Viateur. Yuko Toda, who owns the place with her husband Frederick, serves cuisine of her native Japan, and has taken inspiration for the decoration from her years of graphic design studies in Paris.
influencer2_quote_text: This Mile End spot is a beautifully designed space that evokes serenity and gives you the push you need to engage in productive bursts of creative work. The latte here is unlike anything you’ve ever experienced, and the Japanese siphon-made coffee is a work of art.

establishement_address: 380 Rue Sherbrooke O, Montréal, QC H3G 1J5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: On the final Sunday of each month, the museum open up the Collections and Discovery Exhibitions to the entire public for free (people aged 12 to 30 can get in for free all month long).
influencer2_quote_text: stroll down a street of ancient Pompeii past the enchanted garden, the impluvium, through the leisure spaces, even the bedroom and baths of the typical 79 A.D. home — days before Mount Vesuvius erupted.

establishement_address: 2496 Rue Notre-Dame O, Montréal, QC H3J 1N5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The staggering whisky menu at the Burgundy Lion, a lively British-style pub with dark wood surfaces and frosted glass, offers further means to warm up. The more exotic specimens hail from Taiwan, Sweden, France and Switzerland, while Canadian representatives include Wiser’s Red Letter (12 dollars), a mellow elixir with a hint of toasted nut.
influencer2_quote_text: The Burgundy Lion public house boasts Québec’s trademark bière blanche on tap plus a broad roster of whiskies below TV screens partial to American, Canadian and especially, “European” football. As with bOucon, the world stops here when the puck drops, especially when pursued by la Sainte Flannel, aka the Montréal Canadiens; winners of 24 Stanley Cups.

establishement_address: 417 Rue St. Pierre, Montréal, QC H2Y 2M4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Flyjin is a Japanese restaurant different from anything you’ve ever experienced. Amazing dishes with incredible presentation, a stunning array of cocktails, and a swanky, unique supper club vibe.
influencer2_quote_text: The synchronized lighting system sets the mood to a darker tone making the atmosphere smooth and relaxing. Join the movement under the exclusive underground Izakaya.

establishement_address: 3424 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2X 2H5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The wonderful thing about Pullman is that they have a wine card that is extensive enough to please the toughest sommelier, and staff so knowledgeable, yet unpretentious, that they will convert any newbie.
influencer2_quote_text: Sip on themed flights of three -- rosé, say, or Beaujolais -- beneath an oversized chandelier ofinverted wine glasses.

establishement_address: 245 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H2X 1X7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Most brewpubs in Montreal offer a wide variety of beer styles, and most are quite competent. There’s always a blonde ale. Always an IPA. And always a stout or porter. But Benelux had a menu with a point of view — three different saisons, from funky to savory to citrusy.
influencer2_quote_text: While this microbrewery’s Downtown location has been around for longer, their newer off-the-beaten-path spot in Verdun is a way more enjoyable place to sit with a pint. That’s especially the case during the warm months when they set up their gigantic back patio like an outdoor living room.

establishement_address: 3632 Rue Notre-Dame O, Montréal, QC H4C 1P6
influencer1_quote_text: This sun-filled space at the Jean Talon market is designed to encourage discussion between knowledgeable staff and caffeine-curious customers. Each bag and cup have a unique origin story and taste profile. The Café also bottles their own sodas, including a “spruce” flavour.
influencer2_quote_text: Café Saint-Henri is more than just great coffee, lattes, espressos and locally made desserts, it’s a one-stop-shop for everything coffee related. The entire back section of this trendy, church-themed hot spot is reserved for the roasting of coffee beans, which are then distributed to all the Café Saint-Henri locations in Montreal. The result is an awesome coffee shop with a knowledgeable staff and fresh beans that you can buy and bring home.

establishement_address: 267 Rue Saint Zotique O, Montréal, QC H2V 1A4
influencer1_quote_text: Head roaster Chris Durning gently roasts each small batch in a Probat Burns P-12 with just enough heat to accentuate each green bean without adding smoke or roast flavours. “Doing your job as a roaster means letting the coffee speak for itself.”
influencer2_quote_text: Dispatch, which began as a mobile vendor, is a peerless player on Montreal's coffee scene. Partners Chrissy Durcak and Rebecca Lessard have a smart café in Mile-Ex that doubles as a roastery.

establishement_address: 1023 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2L 1P8
influencer1_quote_text: Il y a dans le travail du chef de 31 ans une volonté de se démarquer, de pousser la cuisine québécoise hors des sentiers battus, d'aller plus loin tout en intégrant cette démarche artistique et intellectuelle à une réalité émotionnelle bien claire : le plaisir.
influencer2_quote_text: I exited Le Mousso elated, not only because my dinner was so stimulating but because I was just so thrilled to be eating seriously sophisticated food in Montreal again. At a time when even our most talented chefs tend to play it casual, how great to see others like Mousseau-Rivard taking the riskier artistic route.

establishement_address: 2047 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2H 1J7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Where else can you order booze by the liter and have it served to you in a mason jar? Also, you get jars of goldfish crackers to snack on while you drink.
influencer2_quote_text: This is a quintessential drinking location in Montreal, especially if you like the idea of drinking from large mason jars. Better go early because this place fills up fast, in all 3 of their locations! Their drinks feature both classic and modern flavors. Every menu explains how strong and or sweet your drink will be.

establishement_address: 5322 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1A5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Its fresh, delicious, and classic dishes helped propel it to the forefront of Montreal’s brunch scene (breakfast banh-mi, holla at me); but if you also happen to enjoy amazing mimosas, then you’re going find another reason to fall in love with Sparrow all over again
influencer2_quote_text: This detail-oriented, hipster-chic spot's always filled with Mile End neighborhood regulars, and's rumored to have the best-looking staff and clientele in the city. Don’t go too far after last call -- they’ll be serving up one of the best hangover brunches in the city the next morning.

establishement_address: 1184 Place Phillips, Montréal, QC H3B 3C8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: We were immediately taken with some of the ambitious-sounding ingredient combinations. Yes, you’ll find pork and shrimp dumplings on Jatoba’s menu, but — hey — how about those roasted eggplant and corn dumplings with eel sauce? Though crispy tofu is ubiquitous, who is pairing it with smashed avocado and cucumber? And as for the classic fried rice, how about a version with duck confit?
influencer2_quote_text: Jatoba is in its second year of business and is spearheaded by Chef Olivier, who brought his talents to Montreal’s business district from Quebec City, where he fell in love with Asian cuisine. Jatoba serves a fusion of Asian and South America cuisine.

establishement_address: 950 Rue Ottawa, Montréal, QC H3C 1S4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: As arguably the most prominent night-club in the cool, dance-savvy Montreal, New City Gas stands proud in Canada's dance pantheon.
influencer2_quote_text: With their main room catering to big acts within the EDM world, New City Gas introduces DSTRKT, a new night taking place in the back terrace that will feature great underground artists on a weekly basis

establishement_address: Vieux-Port de Montréal, Entrée McGill Coin De la Commune et McGill
influencer1_quote_text: The 678 portholes and numerous wall-size glass panels afford superb views of the city skyline, though the best vantage point is the external heated whirlpool bath. There might be no warmer spot amid wintry Montreal.
influencer2_quote_text: Bota Bota is a dinky ferry moored in the Old Port, tastefully converted into a spa. Unwind in a sun-deck whirlpool.

establishement_address: 4869 Av du Parc, Montréal, QC H2V 4E7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Snack on bites like calamari, local cheeses, or a whole roasted chicken that you can pick apart with your drinking companions like the ravenous little wine bar crawlers you are.
influencer2_quote_text: Perfect for an evening with friends, this place has more than wine, with beers and cocktails as well. To munch there’s charcuteries, salads like delicious beet and arugula w/ nuts, and chicken 3-ways! You’ll leave full, fun, and fancy free!

establishement_address: 160 Rue Saint Viateur E, Montréal, QC H2T 1A8, Canada
establishement_address2: 420 Rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Ethan Song and Hicham Ratnani, co-founders of Frank & Oak, both grew up together in Montreal. They opened the store with the mission of helping a generation of men dress and live well at reasonable prices.
influencer2_quote_text: The prices are great considering it's designed and manufactured in Montréal. There's also a coffee bar and a barber on-site – meaning you can get a pick-me-up, a trim and a new wardrobe all in one place.

establishement_address: 1254 Rue Mackay, Montréal, QC H3G 2H4, Canada
influencer1_name: Leslie Brokaw, Erin Trahan, Matthew Barber
influencer1_quote_text: The Upstairs Jazz Bar, actually down a few steps from the street, has been hosting live jazz music nightly since 1995. Big names are infrequent, but the groups are more than competent.
influencer2_quote_text: The nice thing about our story is that we keep writing different chapters, he says. “After 20 years, I still love everything about it — booking the groups, running the business, pricing the menu, doing the sound checks. I love greeting the customers and hearing how much they enjoy the music.”

establishement_address: 243 Rue Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3B 2V5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Pour four drinks simultaneously with their fancy tabletop absinthe fountains, and your liver won't be green much longer.
influencer2_quote_text: Dominion Square Tavern offers a slightly swanky atmosphere, with old fashioned vibes. Partially hidden, the old school British gastro pub is actually located in a refurbished tavern from the 1920s. The dim lighting, the fine foods, and the amazing cocktails are a recipe for a good evening.

establishement_address: 98 Avenue Laurier O, Montréal, QC H2T 2N4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The equipment is great, and it’s a small space, so local DJs — Montreal is chock full of DJs — can come and have a good setup without worrying about pulling a crowd of 600 people. But if it’s midnight and summer, you can always count on it being full of people.
influencer2_quote_text: The house music was pumping and the dranks were flowing. I highly recommend the Rasputin - Russia's favourite love machine

establishement_address: 123 Avenue du Mont-Royal O, Montréal, QC H2T 2S9
influencer1_quote_text: First, they grind high quality coffee beans (Verve – Sermon) then, they use a La Marzocco machine, they steam 3,8% milk (Laiterie Chagnon) and finally with a touch of the amazingness of the staff, you have the best latté in town.
influencer2_quote_text: This place is perfect for snowy days—assuming you can find a seat. On the western end of the Plateau, the extremely popular Café Plume has a cozy vibe with exposed brick and sturdy little wooden tables.

establishement_address: 151 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2X 1H5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: At Mme Lee, the stars of the menu are the cocktails. They can offer you classics or revisited classics, such as Mme Lee’s Iced Tea. They also have specialty cocktails, such as the Pimms Potager or the Cherry Lemonade with Hennessy.
influencer2_quote_text: Mme Lee is so lowkey most people don’t even know about it. It is the coolest spot around Berri-Uqam and lower St-Laurent. Head there for amazing drinks & dope people.

establishement_address: 252 Rachel Est Montreal
influencer1_quote_text: Independent Turkish-owned cafe brewing 49th Parallel and traditional unfiltered coffees. Enjoy the smell of fresh baking as you enter -- everything here (cookies, muffins, pastries) is made in house. - See more at: http://itstodiefor.ca/where-to-eat-in-montreal/#sthash.bjc3phyH.dpuf
influencer2_quote_text: What to try? If you’re a coffee snob, try their Turkish coffee, of course. It’s the result of a simple combination of cold water boiled with a rich, dark roast. The coffee is slightly stronger than most coffees we’re used to consuming so it might be a shock to your palate.

establishement_address: 141 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H1X 2H2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: This place is a total fun-time gold mine. They throw killer events on Wednesdays with DJs that you do not want to miss.
influencer2_quote_text: Salon Daome is the spot on Mont-Royal Avenue for electro music action, of any genre whatsoever. My personal favorite night is on the Wednesdays for Oasis Wednesdays.

establishement_address: 1253 Avenue McGill College, Montréal, QC H3B, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: For a coffee shop buried deep down Montréal’s vast underground network, Tunnel espresso has made quite a reputation for itself despite its unconventional location. This hole‑in‑the‑wall shop serves independently brewed coffee and some of the best macadamia nut cookies in the city.
influencer2_quote_text: The minimally styled coffee bar, with two locations in Montreal’s downtown core, is part of the city’s expanding third wave coffee movement. As such, owner and coffee aficionado Andy Kyres has infused a keen business sense with a generous shot of social responsibility. “My whole ethos is I deal locally; I deal with artisans because I know what I’m getting. I support independent communities in any sense,” he said.

establishement_address: 19 Rue Prince Arthur O, Montréal, QC H2X 1S4, Canada
influencer1_name: Ian Harrison and Rose Maura Lorre
influencer1_quote_text: This self-described espresso bar artisanal gave the previously café-bereft Milton-Parc neighbourhood a lift when it opened in 2013.
influencer2_quote_text: A quaint little coffee shop with a selection of pastries, freshly squeezed juice, and caffeinated brews – what more could you ask for from your neighborhood craft coffee shop?

establishement_address: 244 Rue de Castelnau Est, Montréal, QC H2R 1P5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Larue & Fils now has two idyllic, luminous locations and proudly serves Montréal-brewed coffee. They also have a vintage blue Citroën truck roaming the streets of Montréal in the summertime.
influencer2_quote_text: Le café Larue utilise du café torréfié ici même à Montréal. Ce dernier est torréfié de façon sicilienne. « Larue n’est pas un café de la troisième vague, on est plus traditionnel. On fait du très bon café et on traite le produit avec respect », souligne Guillaume Adan. Côté bouffe, Larue propose plusieurs sandwichs et quelques viennoiseries.

establishement_address: 5330 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: One man’s trash is another man’s livelihood in Mile End, a bohemian neighborhood whose vintage-store-per-capita ratio must be among the highest in North America. Want to get gussied up like a stylish grandparent?
influencer2_quote_text: Its owners Rebecca and Lara, select each piece focusing on quality and current trends. Their pieces end up reflecting classic, timeless styles for both men and women, that slip seamlessly into a modern wardrobe!

establishement_address: 904 Rue Sherbrooke O, Montréal, QC H3A 3R8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: When rustic chic meets third wave coffee shop! This eclectic shop, a tranquil and welcoming retreat from the bustle of downtown, only serves the finest products, like Intelligentsia Coffee and Mast Brothers chocolates.
influencer2_quote_text: A superb little place for your morning and afternoon jolt. Located in the heart of downtown Montreal, the smell of ground coffee beans and freshly baked goods attracts a constant flow of coffee-lovers all day long.

establishement_address: 677 Rue Ste-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 3Y5, Canada
establishement_address2: 3526 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Montreal-based m0851 has been crafting quality leather goods for more than 25 years.
influencer2_quote_text: A balance between charm and functionality have always been at the heart of M0851. With a total of 22 stores located all around the world, its products are entirely conceived and crafted in Montreal

establishement_address: 11 Rue Rachel E, Montréal, QC H2W, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Great bistro with dishes such as Portuguese chicken with spices to die for.
influencer2_quote_text: Everything tastes like chicken. Except no chicken tastes like Romados chicken. The masters of chicken in Montreal know exactly what they are doing when they drophalf a roasted chicken with rice, salad, and fries in front of you.

establishement_address: 3500 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Ecole Privee is also best known for its exotic room filled with naked pictures of women where now you can reserve your own exclusive table. Montreal’s newest underground club has a lot to offer, so make your way to Ecole Privee to experience something fresh and wild.
influencer2_quote_text: he venue has the best sound system currently available in the world and with a very dark atmosphere, Ecole Privee is the gucci spot to hang with the trend setters. Get there early.

establishement_address: 5135 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R9, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Their style aims more towards the younger folk, but a lot of the pieces are so flattering and simple, you could be good to wear them for a long time to come.
influencer2_quote_text: Unicorn is a veritable hunting ground for local fashionistas seeking out the latest trends. It stocks a handpicked selection of local designers as well as international labels for both men and women.

establishement_address: 3709 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Most people go to the Tokyo Bar for the great dancing compliments of top DJs as it's a dance club without the dance club attitude - just high energy dancing.
influencer2_quote_text: The Concordia University urban dictionary calls a crazy grinding dance floor “Tokyo Thursday,” after the famous nightclub’s well-known party night, now going into its seventh year.

establishement_address: 511 Rue de Courcelle, Montréal, QC H4C 3C1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Each delicious tortilla is filled to the brim with tasty ingredients, fresh vegetables, and moist, flavourful meats (think chorizo spiced pulled pork, for example). Add this together with their incredibly fair prices, and you’ve got yourself a new favourite burrito spot, my friend.
influencer2_quote_text: The burritos are quite literally bursting at the seams at St-Henri’s tiny Tejano. Watching the guys behind the counter fill orders is kind of compelling, just to witness the sheer amount of stuff they manage to contain in a single tortilla shell.

establishement_address: 4777 Avenue Pierre-de Coubertin
influencer1_quote_text: Eternal summer awaits inside the humid tropical forest of the Biodôme, a glass-roofed nature preserve containing multiple ecosystems. You might glimpse iguanas, frogs, bats, snakes, sloths and other exotic creatures as you wend your way among the dense vegetation, streams and stone caverns.
influencer2_quote_text: Montreal’s Biodôme Is A Tropical Paradise To Escape To In The City, Like a far away vacation close to home.

establishement_address: 4483 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The mixed crowd appreciates the specially-designed spaces perfectly suited for both dancing and drinking
influencer2_quote_text: This is kind of a cross between a music venue and a regular bar. Just past the entrance is a decent sized room with a bar, pool table and tv's, while down the hallway is the huge venue room with the stage, dance floor, another bar, and both an upper and lower sitting area

establishement_address: 3958 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y3, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Now, this place is as unique as they come. It’s a bar, nightclub, and barber shop all in one. Now that I’ve got your attention. Why Wednesdays? Karaoke, obviously! Who doesn’t love to sing karaoke on a Wednesday night?

establishement_address: 56 Rue Saint Viateur Ouest, Montreal, QC H2T 4K6
influencer1_quote_text: Dans cette boutique de mode vintage très réputée, on déniche bottines à lacets, cols roulés, blazers chics, chemises en velours côtelé, jupes à fleurs, sacs en cuir pour s'inventer un look de hipster canadien à petits prix.
influencer2_quote_text: The hipster-friendly thrift store offers a selection of classic retro clothing, shoes, and accessories from anywhere between the 1950s to the 1990s at very fair prices for the quality you're getting. The owners take great pride in their selection and they are very passionate about their business, fashion in general, and sustainable living.

establishement_address: 3523 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
establishement_hours: vendredi  09:00–19:00 samedi 12:00–17:00 dimanche  Fermé lundi 09:00–17:00 mardi  09:00–19:00 mercredi 09:00–19:00 jeudi 09:00–19:00
influencer1_quote_text: Station 16 is the latest destination for lovers of pop art, graffiti, and street art.
influencer2_quote_text: A modern art gallery that truly invites everyone to take a look at its exhibitions, Station 16 regularly features new artists from around the world, and wants you to see their stuff even if you don't plan on buying anything.

establishement_address: 3670 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Inspired by vintage, 1861 is a glamorous boutique that offers affordable girlie clothes, paying specific attention to dresses! The shop is owned by young entrepreneur Castle Ho, who inspires herself from the Marie-Antoinette-type style.
influencer2_quote_text: Soundly emphasizing Parisian elegance and nestled in Montreal’s utmost cosmopolitan district, Boutique 1861 lets customers travel back in time to the fashionable glamour of yesteryear with dozens of vintage and one-of-a-kind pieces.

establishement_address: 4019 Rue Notre-Dame O, Montréal, QC H4C 1R3, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: La Gaillarde is a non-profit eco-fashion boutique located in the neighbourhood of Saint-Henri in Montreal. Officially opened in 2000, they carry a large range of recycled and organic designs, vintage clothing and accessories for both men and women.
influencer2_quote_text: A chic section of second-hand clothing is also offered for both men and women, and every piece goes through a selection process to ensure La Gaillarde’s high quality standards.

establishement_address: 2015 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T3, Canada
establishement_hours: Monday to Saturday: 10 a.m. to 10 p.m., Sunday 12 p.m. to 8 p.m.
influencer1_quote_text: I’ve spent entire afternoons in this veritable vintage maze rummaging through stacks of bowling shoes, old television sets, stuffed animals, etc. With a towering ‘Everything for $1’ pit, trust me, you’ll be hard-pressed to leave empty handed.
influencer2_quote_text: For a scavenger-hunt-like shopping experience, head to boutique Eva B. This crafty little shop includes a 1$ thrift pile, as well as a few designer finds.

establishement_address: 1115 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Inspired by 1920s cabaret, this drag theater has a dance floor, performances most nights, and is considered a premiere venue. We’re still kicking ourselves for missing the “Spice Girls Drag World Tour” show. Look for the pink-haired drag queen on the retro marquee.
influencer2_quote_text: The lovely drag queens of Cabaret Mado put on a spectacular comedy show, with different themes each night. If you’re in for a laugh, this is the place to go.

establishement_address: 1171 Rue Sainte-Catherine E, Montréal, QC H2L 2G8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Watch for the drag queens walking about who will pour a shot directly into your mouth upon request.The three floors offer different styles of music every night in a friendly and open environment.
